intro: Fumana thymifolia var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved fumana, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and typically have a smooth, hairless surface, giving the plant its varietal name "glabra." It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This plant is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
